definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
tool/device/utensil/equipment/instrument/talent/ability/to possess/to have/to provide/to furnish/to state/classifier for devices, coffins, dead bodies

sentences.english: Is the office near public transport, either the subway or a bus station?
sentences.chinese: 新辦公室離公共交通工具，地鐵或者公共汽車站近嗎？

sentences.english: Stanely:I just moved and there is no public transportation available.
sentences.chinese: 我剛搬家，附近沒有大衆交通工具可搭。

sentences.english: The vehicles are large and not easily adaptable to new uses.
sentences.chinese: 這些交通工具很大，不易改作新的用途。

sentences.english: What kind of transportation can I use to travel around in Yilan?
sentences.chinese: 在宜蘭縣境內我應該使用何種交通工具？

sentences.english: We sit in front of our computers and have vehicles transport us to and fro.
sentences.chinese: 我們只需要坐在電腦前工作或者有交通工具來。

sentences.english: Its non-slip floorings are used in factories and public transport.
sentences.chinese: 被應用在工廠和公共交通工具上。

sentences.english: The opposite of vehicle trouble is driving skillfully.
sentences.chinese: 交通工具故障相對的是熟練駕駛。

sentences.english: Which bar chart represents the average speed of the vehicles?
sentences.chinese: 哪個條形統計圖代表這些交通工具的速度？
這種交通工具是水陸兩用的。

sentences.english: Scout troopers use their swift vehicles to rocket back to their bases to call on heavier forces.
sentences.chinese: 偵察兵依靠迅捷的交通工具飛速趕回基地召喚大部隊。

sentences.english: Alcatraz Cruises is the official carrier for tours to Alcatraz Island.
sentences.chinese: 惡魔島遊艇是惡魔島之旅的官方交通工具。

sentences.english: Do you have to want to belong to your own pileup ?
sentences.chinese: 你有沒有想過屬於你自己的交通工具呢？

sentences.english: While the politicians ride in limos , ordinary people have no decent transportation.
sentences.chinese: 政客們坐着豪華轎車，普通人卻沒有象樣的交通工具。

sentences.english: It will also mount to any vehicle.
sentences.chinese: 這樣將等同於任一交通工具。

sentences.english: The next generation of long distance land-transportation is still in experimental phase in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 長距離的交通工具革新在美國仍然沒有擺脫實驗階段。

sentences.english: Our church has an accumulated energy so I have my personal vehicle.
sentences.chinese: 我們教會有累積的能量，所以我有私用的交通工具。

definition: to get around using a conveyance (car, bicycle, sedan chair etc)/to ride (or drive)/means of transportation
to go out somewhere (relatively short trip)/to set off on a journey (longer trip)
to ride as a passenger/to travel by (car, plane etc)
to carry a passenger/(of spaceships etc) manned/also pr. [zai3 ren2]
to take the car, bus, train etc
